1332311.content:
Footsteps echoed in the cobblestone alleyways as three silhouettes made their way through the ill-lighted street. As they walked under yet another broken lamp, the first silhouette lost it's dark cloak and came into view. He was a thin young man wearing a dark suit. The suit had bright white stitches and straps, and included slim black slacks and black dress shoes. A gray skull found its place where a tie would normally be found, and two identical skull rings adorned both of the boy's middle fingers. He had golden eyes and pale skin, an almost ghost-like complexion. His hair was jet black, with three white stripes wrapping around his head, starting at the left side of his forehead and stopping halfway around. His face held a dark expression, yet at the same time, he seemed calm. This, as you may have guessed, is Death the Kid. The son of Lord Death himself. The two shadows behind him were his allies and weapons, Liz and Patty Thompson.

The odd trio were here in this dark alley in San Francisco by order of Lord Death. Their job was to eliminate a certain Kishin egg known as Robert the Sick. Kid shook his head as they approached the end of the alley. Just what am I up against? How could father possibly... He put his forehead against his right palm. No, he thought, father told me why... Kid remembered the entire conversation. Lord Death had called his son to the Death Room on that particular afternoon to tell him the bad news.

"I have some bad news, Kid," Lord Death had said, staring into his mirror.

"Alright, let's hear it," Kid said.

"There have been reports that an old enemy of mine has returned. Someone called Robert the Sick. I thought he was dead, but it seems he's still around, even after all these years..."

"And you want me to go after him."

"Yes. Do you know why he must be dealt with?"

"Not really. I've never heard of him. Why? What has he done? It must have been severe for you to be so worked up over it."

Death turned around in a snap. "Worked up? What do you mean?" he asked, looming over his son like a vulture, tilting his head with an almost comical curiosity.

"It seems as though you have a history with this guy. Am I right?"

Death's grim expression faded. He was right, as usual. "Yes, I do have a history with him. He's done some evil stuff, Kid. Horrible stuff. The kind of evil that I just can't stand!" Suddenly, his mask twisted into a face of anger and he preformed a Reaper Chop, destroying his skull-shaped coffee table. Kid just managed to catch the teapot and his cup before they hit the ground and shattered. The table, however, was completely destroyed.

Death's voice changed. His happy, cheery tone and high pitched voice disappeared, leaving behind a dark, gravely sound in its place. "Robert the Sick is an evil reprobate with a heart of stone and a mind beyond twisted. His sick pleasures caused so much pain and suffering, THAT i CAN'T EVEN BEGIN TO-" Death stopped himself short and looked back at his son. He wasn't paying half attention, as he was trying to make the table whole again. Old habits die hard, but in this case, Kid's OCD would not let the destruction of a such a lovely, symmetrical table go unfixed.

"Let's see, this piece goes here, that one there...ooh, this one here..."

"KID, ARE YOU EVEN LISTENING TO ME?" The room quaked his voice was so loud. Kid was sent flying onto his backside, the remnants of the table flying past him in every direction. Kid sat there for a moment. Then he got up, brushed the dust off his suit, and composed himself.

"Sorry father. I couldn't help myself."

"I know," Death said with disdain. "Anyway, like I said, this guy is rotten to the core. I want you to take care of him. Permanently. Understand?"

"Yes. I would understand even more if I knew more about this Robert. Why do you hate him so much?"

Death's eyes widened. Should I tell him? Maybe it would be better not to...

"I don't appreciate shooting blind, father. For all I know, this guy could have cut you in line at the grocery store. I need to know who I'm up against."

Death sighed. He might as well. "Very well," he said, his voice returning to it's high-pitched state,"I'll tell you. It was a long time ago. I found out what this guy was doing. He was torturing women all over the place, and eating their souls. Just for kicks! I tried to catch him, but he escaped every time I found him out. He's a slippery character. The last time we fought, he only just managed to get away. I looked for him, but after that, he never showed his face again."

"Until now, that is."

"Yes. Old Rob must have caught word that I never leave Death City. Ever. He's gone back to his old habits, it seems."

"You say he tortured women."

"Yes, that's right. He did awful things to them."

"What sort of things?"

"I shouldn't tell you, Kid...I don't think-"

"Father. Please. Tell me."

"Well..."

Well...what should he do? Should Death tell his son what this Robert guy did to these women? Or should he leave that part out? Up to you. But I'm going to say that Death tells him, so don't choose the first option until I'm done with it, if you would. Thank you.
1332311.title: A Sickening Act: Kid's Glorious Mission?

choices: Next Episode (Continue on with this story line.)
Another Episode (A new episode that isn't related to this story at all.)
13323111.content:
"Alright, son," Death said, his cheery voice flat with grimness, "I'll tell you. But be warned, it is not a tale for the faint of heart."

"For some reason, I get the feeling that you're exaggerating," Kid said.

"No. This is no exaggeration. He's called Robert the Sick for a reason." Suddenly, Death's voice returned once more to its original low tone. Kid was reassured. He never dropped his voice unless he was deadly serious. "To be honest, it wasn't that long ago. But it was back before I changed my voice and image. This guy, Robert...he...captured women, you see. He took them to a place hidden by the trees. It was there that he..." The Grim Reaper turned to face his son. "He made them food and fattened them up to the point where they couldn't move, and then he ripped out their souls as they drowned in pools of their own tears!"

Kid's eyes widened in terror. Such cruelty...

"I had to stop him. But every time I found him, he managed to get away. Now that he's back, I need you to finish what I started, and bring an end to that madman once and for all. Can I count on you to do that?"

Kid stood up. "Of course." And that was the end of it. Now, he was headed to Robert's hideout in the back alleys of San Francisco, accompanied by Liz and Patty. It was not five minutes past midnight, and the air was like ice. Kid stopped in his tracks. Liz and Patty halted.

"What's wrong, Kid?" Liz asked. Patty busied herself with looking everywhere except directly in front of her.

"Nothing," kid said, gesturing to the ramshackle building that stood before them. "We're here."

Next time, on Soul Eater! The Madman Found: Kid Puts His Foot Down!

Your just a average boy living in Death City. You came to this town to study weird and magical creatures that lived near this town. But you lived alone. You didn’t have a partner or anyone to live with at your apartment. You basically lived by yourself most of the time without anyone around. You spent most of your days at home in silence. Just playing video games and watching anime is how you would spend the other days when you were not studying. You went to the grocery store today to buy groceries and supply’s you were running out of. You were on the way home when suddenly you heard a lot shriek coming from the alleyway. You quickly run to the alleyway and drop your groceries somewhere nearby. You looked down the alleyway but you mostly didn’t see anything. You quickly looked for the source of the shrieking but there looks like nothing that made that shriek. But just when you were about to head back you heard the shriek again only this time it was coming from The trashcan. You quickly moved your gaze towards the trashcan as you saw it shake and rattle around. Something must be in there you thought. You slowly moved towards the trashcan and slowly picked up the lid. When you did a purple haired cat jumped onto your head and hissed at the trashcan. “It was just a cat?” You thought. “What could’ve possibly been in there that made it so mad?” Suddenly a big rat emerged from the trash from the garbage hissing at your direction and the purple cat hissed back. The rat jumped towards you ready to attack when quickly you grabbed the pepper spray from your pocket and sprayed down the rat. The rat blinded from the pepper spray hissed, stopped its attack and ran off. You sighed in relief and put the spray back in your pocket. You lifted the cat off your head and looked at it. “You okay little kitty?” You asked the purple cat wearing a strange hat. “I am now! Thank you!” The cat replied. You shocked at the reply and quickly placed it back down and jumped back. You were surprised to see a cat speak back to you. ”What's the matter?” the cat said. ”Ever seen a talking cat?” ”no not once!” you replied still in shock. You studied so many magic creatures but you never heard of a talking cat before. ”oh well everyone says that to me. Thank you for saving my kitty life stranger! Your my hero!” the purple cat walked over to you and brushed itself against your leg. Purring and showing its affection towards you. ”My name is Blair the cat. What's your name?” You simply replied with your name. ”That's a cute name.” Blair said happily. ” I’m forever in your debt. If there's anything you want from me just ask!” Blair then jumped onto your shoulder. Brushing it's head against your cheek. ”Do you have a home Blair?” You asked. “No I don’t I usually live by myself at my pumpkin house in the woods. Would you like to see it?”

What to you do?
